Title: .NET Random Mock Extensions
Description: .NET Random Mock Extensions allow to generate by 1 line of code object implementing any interface or class and fill its properties with random values. This can be usefull for generating test data objects for View or unit testing while you have no real domain object model.
HomeWiki:
Project Description
.NET Random Mock Extensions allow to generate by 1 line of code object implementing any interface or class and fill its properties with random values. This can be usefull for generating test data objects for View or unit testing while you have no real domain object model.

Current implementation depends on project called Moq. You can find here: http://moq.codeplex.com

Example:
You are using MVVM pattern. You have class MyForm, which renders viewmodel IMyFormViewModel specified by interface containing a bunch of properties (including complex properties). You need to test you form, with a minimum coding efforts (avoid implementing IMyFormViewModel and all its properties with test data). This extension allow you to do it with one line of code, like this:
myForm.ViewModel = new Random.NextMock<IMyFormViewModel>();

And you get a form filled with random data, even if your IMyFormViewModel have complex model, like this:

public interface IMyFormViewModel
{
string StrValue {get;}
IEnumerable<IMyFormItemViewModel> Items{get;}
}

public interface IMyFormItemViewModel
{
string DisplayName{get;}
DateTime? Date {get;}
}


After generating random mock object you can obtain its Moq.Mock and customize all properties you need to be not random.

Supports: .NET 4.0
